lines.text: MEMORANDUM
Septcmber 13, 1979
This memo addresses Marketing Research's concerns of the
proposed Brand "B" produet and advertising to be used in
the upcoming "Assessor" sinulated test market.
I. Assessor = Simulated Test Market
The "Assessor" model assumes that the product formulation
and advertising positioning are representative of that which.
would be used at the time of national introduction. This
is not the case for Brand "B." Developmental work for
Brand "B" product and advertisIng has yet to reach chis
national introductory level.
Listed below is the current status of Brand "B's" product
and advertising.
Product
A.
The tar level of the upper range produet has not becn
determincd. This tar level could range from 7 to 9
milligrom.
- Neithor of the 7 or 8 mg. product formulations have
been consumer tested.
- The 9 mg. product was tested vs. the current vICEROY
Rich Lights, a modified VICERoy Rich Lights blend, and
a modified BElA1R blend. Among both full-taste and
f:

E DICDMENT BEING FILMED.

The "Assessor" model assumes that the product formulation
